column1: Next I'm going to ask a few questions about the nutritional guidelines recommended for Americans by the federal government. {Have you/Has SP} heard of My Plate?
column2: {Have you/Has SP} looked up the My Plate plan on the internet?
column3: {Have you/Has SP} tried to follow the recommendations in the My Plate plan?
column4: How old was {SP} when {he/she} completely stopped breastfeeding or being fed breastmilk?
column5: How old was {SP} when {he/she} was first fed formula?
column6: How old was {SP} when {he/she} completely stopped drinking formula?
column7: This next question is about the first thing that {SP} was given other than breast milk or formula. Please include juice, cow's milk, sugar water, baby food, or anything else that {SP} might have been given, even water. How old was {SP} when {he/she} was first fed anything other than breast milk or formula? (Days)
column8: How old was {SP} when {he/she} was first fed milk?
column9: During the school year, about how many times a week {do you/does SP} usually get a complete school lunch?
column10: During the school year, about how many times a week {do you/does SP} usually get a complete breakfast at school?
column11: Next I'm going to ask you about meals. By meal, I mean breakfast, lunch and dinner. During the past 7 days, how many meals {did you/did SP} get that were prepared away from home in places such as restaurants, fast food places, food stands, grocery stores, or from vending machines? {Please do not include meals provided as part of the school lunch or school breakfast./Please do not include meals provided as part of the community programs you reported earlier.}
column12: How many of those meals {did you/did SP} get from a fast-food or pizza place?
column13: Some grocery stores sell "ready to eat" foods such as salads, soups, chicken, sandwiches and cooked vegetables in their salad bars and deli counters. During the past 30 days, how often did {you/SP} eat "ready to eat" foods from the grocery store? Please do not include sliced meat or cheese you buy for sandwiches and frozen or canned foods.
column14: During the past 30 days, how often did you {SP} eat frozen meals or frozen pizzas? Here are some examples of frozen meals and frozen pizzas.
column15: Now I'm going to ask you some general questions about {SP's} eating habits. Was {SP} ever breastfed or fed breastmilk?
column16: What type of milk was {SP} first fed? Was it . . .
column17: What type of milk was {SP} first fed? Was it . . .
column18: What type of milk was {SP} first fed? Was it . . .
column19: What type of milk was {SP} first fed? Was it . . .
column20: What type of milk was {SP} first fed? Was it . . .
column21: What type of milk was {SP} first fed? Was it . . .
column22: Now I'm going to ask a few questions about milk products. Do not include their use in cooking. In the past 30 days, how often did {you/SP} have milk to drink or on {your/his/her} cereal? Please include chocolate and other flavored milks as well as hot cocoa made with milk. Do not count small amounts of milk added to coffee or tea. Would you say...
column23: What type of milk was it? Was it usually . . .
column24: What type of milk was it? Was it usually . . .
column25: What type of milk was it? Was it usually . . .
column26: What type of milk was it? Was it usually . . .
column27: What type of milk was it? Was it usually . . .
column28: What type of milk was it? Was it usually . . .
column29: The next question is about regular milk use. A regular milk drinker is someone who uses any type of milk at least 5 times a week. Using this definition, which statement best describes {you/SP}?...
column30: Now, I'm going to ask you how often {you/SP} drank milk at different times in {your/his/her} life. How often did {you/SP} drink any type of milk, including milk added to cereal when {you were/s/he was} a child between the ages of 5 and 12 years old? Would you say...
column31: Now, I'm going to ask you how often {you/SP} drank milk at different times in {your/his/her} life. How often did {you/SP} drink any type of milk, including milk added to cereal when {you were/s/he was} a teenager between the ages of 13 and 17 years old? Would you say...
column32: Now, I'm going to ask you how often {you/SP} drank milk at different times in {your/his/her} life. How often did {you/SP} drink any type of milk, including milk added to cereal when {you were/s/he was} a young adult between the ages of 18 and 35 years old? Would you say...
column33: The next questions are about meals provided by community or government programs. In the past 12 months, did {you/SP} receive any meals delivered to {your/his/her} home from community programs, "Meals on Wheels", or any other programs?
column34: In the past 12 months, did {you/SP} go to a community program or senior center to eat prepared meals?
column35: During the school year, {do you/does SP} attend a kindergarten, grade school, junior or high school?
column36: Does {your/SP's} school serve school lunches? These are complete lunches that cost the same every day.
column37: {Do you/Does SP} get these lunches free, at a reduced price, or {do you/does he/she} pay full price?
column38: Does {your/SP's} school serve a complete breakfast that costs the same every day?
column39: {Do you/Does SP} get these breakfasts free, at a reduced price, or {do you/does he/she} pay full price?
column40: (Do you/Does SP) get a free or reduced price meal at any summer program (he/she) attends?
column41: Next I have some questions about {your/SP?s} eating habits. In general, how healthy is {your/his/her} overall diet? Would you say . . .
column42: {Are you/Is SP} the person who does most of the planning or preparing of meals in {your/SP's} family?
column43: {Do you/Does SP} share in the planning or preparing of meals with someone else?
column44: {Are you/Is SP} the person who does most of the shopping for food in {your/SP's} family?
column45: {Do you/Does SP} share in the shopping for food with someone else?
column47: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems: little interest or pleasure in doing things? Would you say...
column48: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
column49: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
column50: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] feeling tired or having little energy?
column51: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] poor appetite or overeating?
column52: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
column53: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching TV?
column54: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
column55: [Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems:] Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way?
column56: How difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with people?
